item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description:
Experience

Ergonomics & Biomechanics Specialist

National Research Centre for the Working Environment (Denmark)
Research Exchange — 2023–2024

  • Conducted an epidemiological study on musculoskeletal disorders in professional cleaners.
  • Analyzed large datasets, prepared statistical summaries, and contributed to methodology refinement.
  • Collaborated with interdisciplinary teams focused on occupational health.

Consultant in Workplace Biomechanics

Freelance — 2021–2023

  • Assessed ergonomic risk factors in industrial and service environments.
  • Designed preventive strategies for work-related musculoskeletal disorders (WMSDs).
  • Trained workers and supervisors on posture optimization and safe task execution.

item.title: Education
item.description:
Formal Degrees

  • PhD in Ergonomics & Biomechanics — University of Copenhagen (in progress; emphasis on occupational safety analytics and predictive modeling).
  • Master’s in Bioinformatics — Université de Lille (focus on multivariate statistics for health sciences; thesis on motion capture datasets).
  • Bachelor’s in Sports Sciences — Universidad Nacional de Colombia (specialized in movement physiology and coaching methodologies).

Complementary Coursework

  • Certificate in Occupational Epidemiology, Karolinska Institutet — distance module completed in 2022 with a capstone project on shift work and circadian stress.
  • Micro-credential in Data Visualization with R & ggplot2, Coursera — ongoing; applying lessons to ergonomics dashboards.

Research Highlights

  • Co-authored three peer-reviewed articles on biomechanical modeling for cleaning workers, accepted in regional occupational health journals.
  • Presented findings at the Nordic Conference on Musculoskeletal Disorders (2023), emphasizing actionable recommendations for unions.

item.title: My Sky
item.description:
Western Astrology Snapshot

  • Sun in Taurus — keeps my research grounded; I anchor projects with patient iteration.
  • Moon in Aquarius — fuels curiosity for collective wellbeing and experimental study designs.
  • Rising Sagittarius — the optimistic teacher energy that shows up when presenting fieldwork stories.
  • Current transit focus: balancing Saturn’s structure with Venus-led creativity in collaborative teams.

Chinese Earthly Branches & Elements

  • Born in the Wood Ox year, so long-game strategies and persistence feel natural.
  • Monthly pillar sits in Metal Snake, reminding me to refine details and honor intuition.
  • I keep a small spreadsheet tracking how each branch/element shows up in mood, energy, and relationship dynamics.

Rituals Under the Sky

  • New Moon sketches combine ergonomic diagrams with constellation lines.
  • Full Moon playlists guide restorative stretching sessions for colleagues after audits.

item.title: Other Interests & Skills
item.description:
Languages

  • Spanish (native), English (professional), French (conversational), Danish (learning through immersion and Duolingo streaks).

Tech & Creative Tools

  • Comfortable with R, Python, and Julia for exploratory data work.
  • Vector sketching in Affinity Designer to quickly translate motion studies into visual briefings.
  • Podcast editing with Audacity for community science interviews.

Community & Volunteering

  • Volunteer ergonomics coach for a Bogotá-based circus arts collective, helping acrobats map safe progression plans.
  • Occasional guest lecturer for Latin American public health students, highlighting inclusive research design.

Favorite Side Projects

  1. Santi Moves Newsletter — bite-sized case studies about the human factors behind overlooked jobs.
  2. Field Recording Walks — capturing city ambiences that later accompany movement workshops.

item.title: Personal Development
item.description:
Practices That Ground Me

  • Somatic training: 10-minute micro-sessions woven into workdays to reset posture, breathing, and attention.
  • Mindfulness journaling: Weekly prompts centered on gratitude, boundary-setting, and tracking energy highs/lows.

Learning Rituals

  1. Quarterly learning sprint — 4-week self-designed program; current topic: translating lab-grade motion analysis to low-resource workplaces.
  2. Peer reflection pods — Monthly video calls with ergonomics peers; each session ends with a tangible experiment to try before the next call.

Micro-goals in Progress

  • Publish a short explainer on biomechanical load for non-specialist audiences.
  • Develop a bilingual infographic kit that unions can adapt.
  • Mentor at least two undergraduate interns during upcoming field visits.
